caption:
The photograph captures two men engaged in river fishing. The setting is a muddy riverbank with some vegetation and tree branches visible in the area.

The man in the foreground is actively fishing. He is dressed in a plaid shirt, jeans, and knee-high rubber boots to wade in the water, and wears a baseball cap. This man is bending over as he uses a large fishing net to scoop up fish from the water, showing some motion and activity.

The man in the background is seated, possibly keeping a lookout or resting. He wears sunglasses, a camouflage jacket, and what appears to be some type of hunting or outdoor cap. He is holding what looks like a cigarette or small cigar in his right hand and seems to be watching the activity or waiting his turn.

Around them are tools likely used in their fishing activity: buckets (one red, one gray) and an additional net or some fishing gear on the ground. The river itself is murky and rushing, indicating either recent rain or a fast-moving current, contributing to the rugged and outdoor nature of the scene. The overall impression is one of active participation in nature and a snapshot of outdoor, rural life.
title: Annual smelt run at Singing Bridge, Tawas City. In mid-April thousands of fishermen gather at Whitney Drain, a manmade canal on Lake Huron, to dipnet for these small fish. These fishermen are throwing back the undersized smelt.
